description: Western Marina presents expansive 5495 to 10910 square feet residences, epitomizing luxury living in the heart of Nanakaramguda, Gachibowli. With 4 bedrooms and contemporary design, each unit is a testament to refined taste and sophistication.

project_description.description: Futuristic Urban Oasis: Prestige Clairemont stands proudly within Neopolis, a visionary urban expanse in Kokapet, Hyderabad. Spanning over 500 acres, Neopolis emerges as a beacon of futuristic urban development, blending innovation with functionality.

Tower of Prestige: Standing tall with 45 floors, Western Marina commands attention as a symbol of prestige and sophistication. Its towering presence in Nakaramguda, Gachibowli, signifies a lifestyle elevated above the ordinary.

Abundance of Options: With 450 units spread across four towersin 7.75 Acres, Western Marina provides a diverse range of living options to suit every lifestyle and preference. Whether you seek a cozy retreat or a sprawling penthouse, there's a residence tailored just for you.

Western Marina marries unmatched grandeur with modern minimalism, resulting in a timeless architectural masterpiece. Every corner exudes sophistication, from the sleek facade to the thoughtfully designed interiors.

Exclusivity Personified: Experience exclusivity like never before at Western Marina, where every aspect of the living experience is curated for a select few. From the private amenities to the personalized service, residents enjoy a lifestyle reserved for the discerning few.

Western Marina seamlessly integrates into the vibrant fabric of Nakaramguda, Gachibowli, offering residents the best of both worlds. Enjoy the tranquility of suburban living without sacrificing access to the city's conveniences and attractions.

Unparalleled Luxury: Prepare to be immersed in unparalleled luxury and sophistication at Western Marina. Every detail is meticulously designed to elevate your living experience, ensuring that each moment spent within its walls is nothing short of extraordinary.
